name: Variety
description: Mushrooms come in all shapes, colors, and sizes.
This mushroom is species is Marasmius oreades. It is better known as the "Fairy Ring" because it is often found in groups that form large rings.
While this clearly looks like a mushroom, it has some unique properties that set it appart. Click the annotations to learn more.

annotations.label: Wide Gills
description: Gills can be attached to the stem or free from it. They are seperated with deep channels.

annotations.label: Cap
description: The cap is typically 1 to 5 cm across. It has a bell shape and maintains a slight central bump.
It can vary from white and brown to reddish tan. The color can change significantly as it dries out.

annotations.label: Stem
description: The stem tends to be between 2 to 8 cm long and 1.5 to 6 mm thick. It is considered to be dry, tough, and pliant
